title: Ticket #1857: sysapi_phys_mem() failing on AIX (nmi-build31)
description:
Since the 7.5.5 upgrade yesterday, the startd has been failing at startup. The log is littered with: 
01/20/11 09:23:28 Error computing physical memory with calc_phys_mem().
                MEMORY parameter not defined in config file.
                Try setting MEMORY to the number of megabytes of RAM.
01/20/11 09:23:28 ERROR "Can't compute physical memory." at line 69 in file /home/condor/execute/dir_178504/userdir
/src/condor_startd.V6/ResAttributes.cpp

A diff of of phys_mem.cpp vs. phys_mem.c (from 7.5.4): 

diff --git a/src/condor_sysapi/phys_mem.cpp b/src/condor_sysapi/phys_mem.cpp
index 7b67a05..515feb9 100644
--- a/src/condor_sysapi/phys_mem.cpp
+++ b/src/condor_sysapi/phys_mem.cpp
@@ -222,14 +222,14 @@ sysapi_phys_memory_raw_no_param(void)

        /* get me the various memory entries that represent the full amount of
                memory on the machine */
-    mret = odm_get_obj(cuat, "name like mem? AND attribute='size'",
+    mret = (struct CuAt *)odm_get_obj(cuat, "name like mem? AND attribute='size'",
                &mem_ent, ODM_FIRST);
-    while(mret != NULL)
+    while(mret != NULL && (int)mret != -1)
     {
                /* This value appears to be in Megabytes. */
                memory_size += atoi(mem_ent.value);

-        mret = odm_get_obj(cuat, NULL, &mem_ent, ODM_NEXT);
+        mret = (struct CuAt *)odm_get_obj(cuat, NULL, &mem_ent, ODM_NEXT);
     }

     if (odm_close_class(cuat) < 0)
remarks:
2011-Feb-01 16:20:02 by tannenba:
Bulk change of target version from v070506 to NULL using ./ticket-target-mover.

2020-Jul-31 14:36:33 by jfrey:
AIX support was dropped a long time ago.
creator: nleroy
